types.html:
s'en prendre plein la figure

  1. (informal) to be hauled over the coals, to take a lot of heat, to get it in the neck, to get a bollocking (to get severely criticized, to get castigated); to be insulted
    Synonyms: s'en prendre plein la tronche, s'en prendre plein la gueule
    Je m'en suis pris plein la figure. ― I was hauled over the coals, I got a bollocking; I was really insulted.

Usage notes

[edit]
  • The se is a reflexive indirect object; it is facultative, though the variant en prendre plein la figure is rare(r).

See also

[edit]
  • en prendre pour son grade
  • prendre cher
  • se faire traiter de tous les noms
trans: to be hauled over the coals, to take a lot of heat, to get it in the neck, to get a bollocking

title: s'en prendre plein la figure
pronunHtml: • IPA(key): /s‿ɑ̃ pʁɑ̃.dʁə plɛ̃ la fi.ɡyʁ/
